canonical_flops.description: High-card Ace flop with limited straight or flush potential; typically cautious play is advised.
High-card King with moderate connectivity, offering some straight potential but limited draws; generally cautious.
High-card Queen on a connected board with open-ended straight draws; encourages aggressive play.
High-card Jack with potential for straight draws but few flush possibilities; typically an aggressive board.
High-card Ten with some straight potential but no flush draws; balanced cautious to aggressive play.
High-card Nine with flush draw potential but limited straight connectivity; cautious play suggested.
High-card Eight on a disconnected board, few draw opportunities; cautious play is typical.
High-card Seven on a very disconnected board with minimal draw potential; favors cautious play.
High-card Six with some low-card straight potential; mostly cautious play.
High-card Five with low straight potential and limited draws; cautious play is typical.
High-card Four with low straight potential and minimal draws; generally encourages cautious play.
High-card Three with minimal connectivity; cautious play is recommended.
